visualization_prompt: Generate a stacked bar chart showing gender distribution percentages across Swedish professions using categorical data grouping with percentage stacking

subtitle.text: Source: Synthetic data based on Swedish labor statistics patterns

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional categorical data comparing gender distribution across professions. Each record consists of profession (nominal categorical) and percentage values (ratio scale) for both genders. Synthetic data maintains original statistical relationships (μ_women=87.4%, σ_women=7.3) while expanding to 10 categories for completeness, preserving inverse correlation between gender percentages (r=-1.0). The stacked bar format maximizes data-ink ratio by directly encoding proportions through bar segments, while Cairo's principles are applied through position-based encoding for accurate proportion perception and high-contrast color differentiation. Percentage stacking enables immediate comparison of gender dominance patterns across professions, with synthetic data maintaining realistic labor market distributions (e.g., 95% female midwives vs 5% male).
